scenes.description: You're standing in front of the door to the locker room. It's your first time here since joining the company.

You slide the door open and timidly poke your head in. A man says from across the room
Jim McHeel: "Way to be on time, kid.
Great impression on your first day."

commands.label: Ignore Jim and walk to locker

scenes.description:
Jim McHeel grabs you by the shoulder and spins you around
Jim McHeel: "HEY! You got a hearin' problem, boy?"

Player: "Sorry, I -"
Jim McHeel: "Yeah, you'd damn well better apologize boy. Now pick up my hat."
Jim McHeel throws his hat on the ground at your feet.

Jim McHeel: "Oh great, deaf and mute. You're gonna be a blast to work with in the ring.
I bet you can't even follow simple directions. Pick up my hat."
Jim McHeel throws his hat on the ground at your feet.

Jim McHeel: "That's a good boy. Now, put it on my head. GENTLY."
Jim McHeel throws his hat on the ground at your feet.

Jim McHeel: "I SAID PICK. UP. MY. HAT."
Jim McHeel gestures towards his hat, resting on the ground near your feet.

Tim Bookerman walks in to the room clutching a piece of paper.
Tim Bookerman: "McHeel! Get the hell out to the ring, your music is already playing!"

Jim McHeel glares at you, then hurriedly stomps out the door.

The locker room goes mostly quiet. Small chuckles can be heard.
Jim McHeel: "Kid... You. Will. Regret. This."

Tim Bookerman walks in to the room clutching a piece of paper.
Tim Bookerman: "McHeel! Get the hell out to the ring, your music is already playing!"

Jim McHeel glares at you, then hurriedly stomps out the door.
You cram Jim's hat in the mostly full trashcan, covering it in all sorts of God-knows-what but leaving enough of it sticking out the top so he'll notice.
